responses.rationale: The segment describes the spread and difficulty of containment, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes symptoms and severity, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment reports an outbreak, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes symptoms, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a future possibility ('restrictions may be short-lived') without linking to current calm/safety.
Describes a preparedness measure ('actively monitored') without linking to current calm/safety.
The segment describes susceptibility, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the state of farmers and the spread/impact of the virus, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes economic impact and stock levels, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes the scale of impact (deaths), not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes an implemented safeguard ('will start vaccinating birds') without linking to current calm/safety.
Discusses the ability/capability to address the challenge ('have the ability to actually address the challenge') without linking to current calm/safety.
The segment describes concerns and risks, not a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes spread, deaths, concerns, and impacts, not a capability or preparedness measure.
Describes a recommended safeguard ('urging dairy workers to wear personal protective equipment') without linking to current calm/safety.
Describes a recommended safeguard ('urging dairy workers to wear personal protective equipment') without linking to current calm/safety.
The segment describes a potential failure state, not a specific capability or preparedness measure.
Mentions an organization ('CEPI') that helps fund vaccine research, describing a preparedness activity without linking to current calm/safety.
The segment describes a natural phenomenon and uncertain outcome, not a capability or preparedness measure.
